description.narrative: Support to agriculture and rural development through promotion of confidence building measures

activity-description.narrative: The SARD Programme aims to boost the collaboration between central and local authorities, as well as among the regional organizations from ATU Gagauzia and Taraclia district, so as to foster the social-economic development of the region and of the Republic of Moldova as a whole. he SARD Programme aims to boost the collaboration between central and local authorities, as well as among the regional organizations from ATU Gagauzia and Taraclia district, so as to foster the social-economic development of the region and of the Republic of Moldova as a whole. sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative:
Target: Officially registered unemployed in ATU Gagauzia and Taraclia district decreased by at least 10% Target: 120,000 persons (roughly the entire population of the region) benefited from improved services and renovated infrastructure Target: Successful implementation of the National ARDS in targeted regions
1.1. 50 joint activities organized local, regional and national level institutions (missions, seminars, study trips), including at least 5 study visits in EU countries (with mixed and balanced participation)
1.2. Comprehensive community participatory capacity development processes conducted in 30 communities (representing 50% from the total targeted number) 1.3. Improved cooperation between local authorities, businesses and civil society organizations
1.1. Strengthened rural business support infrastructure
1.2. Fully functional Regional SYSLAB Center operating in Comrat, implementing the employability and entrepreneurship components, being connected and sharing best practices with the rest of the centers on same network
3.1. 20 small scale infrastructure projects implemented in target localities 3.2. 7 models of inter municipal local public services created in the targeted region (at least one connecting communities across autonomous administrative units);

comment.narrative:
1. % of officially registered unemployed in ATU Gagauzia and Taraclia district
Baseline: for ATU Gagauzia - 804 newly registered unemployed in 2014, 704 in 2013; for Taraclia district – 636 persons in 2014, 654 in 2013;
2. Number of people benefited from improved services and renovated infrastructure
3. Level of ARDS implementation in the targeted regions

2018 targets 1.1. 20 joint activities organized local, regional and national level institutions (missions, seminars, study trips) 1.2. Comprehensive community participatory capacity development processes conducted in 41 communities across ATU Gagauzia and Taraclia 1.4. Enhanced capacity of newly created Local Action Groups (80% of LAGs members from target communes trained)
2.1. 8 Targeted trainings conducted (including study tour to Austria/Germany an Business week in Gagauzia/Taraclia) to strengthen rural business support infrastructure 2.2. At least 2 sector business associations supported and strengthened 2.3. 1,000 persons benefited from business support infrastructure 2.4. Improved cooperation between local authorities, businesses and civil society organizations 2.5. Number of officially registered unemployed in TAU Gagauzia and Taraclia district decreased by at least 10% 2.6. 100 new jobs created directly related to improved living conditions in rural areas 2.7. At least 5,000 women and men (50% women) benefiting from strengthened livelihoods 2.8. Fully functional Regional SYSLAB Center operating in Comrat, implementing the employability and entrepreneurship components; being connected and sharing best practices with the rest of the centers on same network 2.9. At least 60 direct beneficiaries successfully pass the tailored trainings and coaching and success rate for employability of 60% and entrepreneurship of at least 10% is achieved.
3.1. 17 small scale infrastructure projects implemented in target localities 3.2. 5 models of inter-municipal local public services created in the targeted region (at least 2 connecting communities across autonomous administrative units) 3.3. 80,000 persons (roughly the entire population of the region) benefited from improved services and renovated infrastructure

1.1. 104 joint activities organized local, regional and national level institutions (missions, seminars, study trips): • Four LEADER/CLLD study visits to Bulgaria, Greece, Poland and Portugal (46 participants: 32 women, 14 men) • four in-country local study learning, information and sharing events/visits on best LPA and IMC experiences conducted in communities outside the target area (138 participants: 87 women, 51 men) • SARD LEADER Conference in Chisinau with participations of all Moldavian LAGs representatives (313 participants: 165 women, 148 men) • 4 local, regional and national events for promotion of the LEADER Program (110 participants: 76 women, 34 men • 95 Community meeting organized by the 8 LAGS in frame of SARD LEADER Call – Towards Prospering Villages 1.2. LPAs capacity development activities continued throughout all targeted territory as follows: • 140 monitoring and coaching visits in the target communities. • 41 LPAs, and 20 NGOs/CSOs were assisted to identify funds for additional local development initiatives (projects) responding to the identified development priorities in LSED Strategies. • on-going monitoring, coaching and support of 46 communities members of 7 IMC clusters capacity building activities in efficient waste management 1.4. Ongoing mentorship offered to LAG managers and project implementers in designing and implementing better quality local development projects. 100 % of LAG management were trained in narrative and financial reporting, in in organisation of call of proposals and all reporting procedures, in project cycle management. 2.1. 8 Targeted trainings conducted (including study tour to Austria/Germany an Business week in Gagauzia/Taraclia) to strengthen rural business support infrastructure 2.2. 2 cross-sectoral business associations established, supported and strengthened 2.3. 1125 persons benefited since start of the programme from business support infrastructure 2.5. Number of officially registered unemployed in TAU Gagauzia and Taraclia district decreased by over 30% since 2016 2.6. 208 new jobs created directly related to improved living conditions in rural areas 2.7. 155 102 people: 77 653 women and 77 449 men are benefitiing from strengthened livelyhoods 2.8. Regional SYSLAB Center was fully operational in Comrat, 2.9. Employability success rate (on average for the period of 2016-2018) is 96 per cent (178 employed out of 186 trained) and entrepreneurship success rate is 35 per cent (33 started own business out of 106 trained).
3.1. 17 small scale infrastructure projects have been completed in 2018 ( total 41 since programme start) in target region 3.2. 5 models of inter-municipal local public services implemented (total 7 since programme start) in the targeted region (4 of them connecting communities across autonomous administrative units) 3.3. 155 102 people: 77 653 women and 77 449 men (roughly the entire population of the region) benefited from improved services and renovated infrastructure since start of the programme
